column1: '''Robert E. Howard''' (22 January 1906 â€“ 11 June 1936) was an American author
column2: famous for his stories about [[Wikipedia:Conan the Barbarian|Conan the Barbarian]] and for creating the genre [[Wikipedia:Sword and sorcery|sword and sorcery]].
[[L. Sprague de Camp]] had sent [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] a copy of his anthology ''[[Swords & Sorcery]]''
column3: which included Howard's short story "[http://gutenberg.net.au/ebooks06/0600971.txt Shadows in the Moonlight]". Tolkien sent [[Letter to L. Sprague de Camp|a letter to de Camp in August 1964]]
column4: expressing mixed opinions about the stories in the anthology.<ref>{{CG|C}}
column6: when de Camp and [[Wikipedia:Alan E. Nourse|Alan E. Nourse]] visited Tolkien for an interview
column7: he "indicated that he 'rather liked' Howard's Conan stories".<ref>[[L. Sprague de Camp]]

column2: Howard's "[http://gutenberg.net.au/ebooks06/0600731.txt The Valley of the Worm]" appeared alongside two of Tolkien's poems in the anthology ''[[Young Magicians]]'' (edited by [[Lin Carter]]).
Robert E. Howard and the Birth of Modern Fantasy]]''
